items.content:
Technical Program Manager 100K

Crossover

Job Description

Do you get excited when you read Ben Horowitz’s definition of a good product owner? Do you love bringing valuable software products to market? Do you have a strong technical background so that you can work closely with the engineering teams, but at the same time do you have an excellent understanding of product lifecycles? If so, this role is for you.

We are looking for a world-class Technical Program Manager to help us define and build the software products that underpin our continued success. In this hands-on role, you will orchestrate the delivery of your products, from setting specifications to execution and continual refinement, as you receive feedback from Product Managers and other stakeholders.

You will be working directly with our engineering teams to make our roadmap become real products. As a result, we are looking for a person that has a good technical software background. We will be measuring your performance based on the volume of quality features being released to production, which emphasizes how tightly you will be working with the various execution teams.

This is a completely remote position. You can work from anywhere, and will be collaborating with people from all over the world. Therefore, strong communication and presentation skills will be crucial for your success.


Company Description:

Aurea enables global enterprises to create transformative experiences for their end customers across a range of industries including retail, travel & hospitality, energy, life sciences, and insurance. Aurea products enable companies to build, execute, monitor, and optimize the end-to-end customer journey across multiple channels and touchpoints to maximize growth through a superior customer experience. Aurea serves over 2,000 customers worldwide.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Work with the product team to define the product roadmap that will add significant value to Aurea

  • Create and prioritize the product backlog

  • Coordinate end-to-end delivery of multiple projects across multiple engineering teams

  • Work with our engineering teams daily in one scrum team to go from comps to working software

  • Create detailed working packages from Product Managers’ specifications

  • Review the features delivered by the engineering teams and demo them to Product Manager

  • Manage a development process with an expected weekly (or faster) production release within a fast-changing and highly agile framework

  • Work Primarily with tech-heavy projects


Total compensation: $100,000/year

Location: Global (remote)

40 hours per week

Skills & Requirements

Required Skills, Experience, and Education:

  • 5+ years of technical product management and/or project management experience

  • 2+ years of experience in programming (coding is not required in this role)

  • Experience bringing software products to market

  • Background with larger proven products

  • Experience on products actually used in Production

  • Demonstrated ability to create, manage, and prioritize a product backlog that adds value to the company

  • Familiarity with InVision, JIRA, and Sketch software development tools

  • Ability to understand technology discussions in the context of a service-oriented architecture and a modern UI tech stack

  • Ability to create detailed technical working packages from higher-level specifications

  • Extraordinary technical background

  • Bachelor’s degree from a top-tier university (degrees in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Electrical Engineering, or a related field are preferred)


This role will be a great fit for you if:

  • You are technical but love developing great products

  • You have worked on proven products especially those used in production

  • You have Extraordinary technical background

  • You love to be creative and innovate in product development

  • You can work closely with a team to coordinate, inspire, and execute

  • You have a sense of measured urgency—you’re able to make things happen quickly and correctly, even with large teams, in tedious situations, and in dynamic, constantly changing environments

  • You make decisions quickly and own them, and you change your mind as the data dictates

  • You are super detailed-oriented

  • You are fearless in seeking out more efficient solutions and constantly challenge the status quo


We’re one of the few legitimate companies offering high-paying jobs that are 100% remote / work from home. You never have to fight traffic to the office again, and you have the freedom to choose when and where you put in your 40 hours to be most effective each week.

To qualify, please provide a resume / CV demonstrating the required experience and skills. From there, to help us find the top 1% of talent, there will be a series of interviews and online skills examinations. We realize these are challenging and can require a decent amount of time, so we thank you in advance for your efforts.

About Crossover

Crossover is redefining the way people work. Brick and mortar offices are history. The future of our global workforce will be built from teams collaborating from every corner of the world. We have embarked on an expedition to find and engage with that talent. Crossover has developed a unique method of finding, curating, and managing remote contractors. And now, as a fully distributed company headquartered in Texas, United States we have more than 800 people working for us in over 50 countries. Our platform connects customers to the world's best talent for both technical and non-technical employment. But we don’t just find the best, we also provide the tools, training, and relationship building support to ensure success for long term growth.

Anywhere

items.title: Engineering Manager / Director
items.content:
Is writing the first line of code on a brand new product something that scares you? What about hiring an engineering team? Setting up the tools, infrastructure, defining the architecture in the first few weeks in the job too much for you? If the early years give you energy, continue reading.

We are a small team of experienced entrepreneurs, with a significant investment from a premier investor, taking on one of the biggest challenges of the 21st century: The healthcare industry. The part of the industry that touches people lives directly using modern technology, that helps them get care when needed and gives them peace of mind during some of the least fun moments in life. We can't say too much about it, but we have a few buzz words to throw out there: Mobile, AI, digital, universal access, easy to use, beautiful, modern, integration, global, behavioural science.

You are a top engineer, architecture connoisseur, lead-by-example kind of person. You've been there and done that. You know the hundreds (thousands?) of gotchas for building an infrastructure to support Mobile, Web, Email, SMS experiences and more. You can balance engineering excellence with the business and product needs. And, you do it fast, really fast.

This opportunity is not for the faint-hearted. A lot of responsibilities will rest on your shoulders, and the expectations are high. You'll be the first engineer in the team and the first leader. Your beliefs and philosophies will define the engineering team beliefs and philosophies. You'll help us craft the product, the processes, the tools, and, most important of all, the team. We are just starting out, and we have great clarity in our vision and mission; now we need to figure out the how and what.

What we expect from you:

- You have a formal education in Computer Science, Computer Engineer, or equivalent (in place of that, you acquired those skills after many years of on-the-job training, working with other extraordinary software engineers).
- You are a master at software architecture, componentisation, microservices, infrastructure, etc.
- You are pragmatic and don't overdo on abstraction, testing, and processes, but you understand the value and trade-offs.
- You are comfortable with all the duties of DevOps, from continuous integration to cloud management, sprinkled with some DBA skills. In the early days, we'll have to share these responsibilities with other people on the team until we hire for that role.
- You are very comfortable defining APIs, building backend services, using relational databases (and document-based / NoSQL DB), messaging queues, cloud services (AWS or Azure), etc.
- You are good (or great) at HTML, CSS, JS, and some of the modern web frameworks (React, Bootstrap, Angular, SASS / LESS, etc.)
- You've worked with mobile developers, lead a team of mobile developers, or built mobile applications yourself.
- You've managed developers and know many exceptional developers here in London (we'll need to hire them as well).
- Oh, and you are great with people! You'll be a manager. You'll also participate in strategic decisions, board meetings, and even customer visits every once in a while.
- What about the technology stack? You get to pick it from one of the moderns one: NodeJS, .NET, Python, etc. (Sorry, but no-go for RoR or PHP)

What you'll get from us:

- Work with talented individuals, where you can learn from and teach each other.
- Accelerate your career by ten years in just three!
- Great freedom to be the best that you can be (and become better): flexible hours, access to whatever devices & software you need.
- Work on a meaningful product to help people, doctors, nurses, and more.
- Work in the heart of London in a very cool office space.
- A top of the market salary and compensation package.
- We are firm believers in the value of diversity and equality at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age or marital status.

This position is based in London, and we work at a fantastic co-working space in Oxford Circus. We are not interested in remote workers, contractors, or working with recruiters. Your compensation will be above market (we saved the money we'd pay a recruiter and bump up your salary), and you'll get many other real benefits.

We are biased by competency, action, kindness, collaboration, speed, and modern approaches and look forward hearing from you.

items.title: Head of Digital
items.content:
*Strengthen our marketing function and launch new products for a purposeful, transparent brand*

_Do you love using your marketing instincts to accelerate a company’s growth? "GrantTree":http://granttree.co.uk are government funding experts. Over the last six years we have raised over £50 million for our clients. Over the coming year we want to prototype new services, enter new markets, and strengthen our online presence. To make this happen, we’re expanding our marketing team.

That’s where you come in as our new Head of Digital.

As an experienced all-rounder specialising in digital, you will have a key role to play in crafting our communications strategy. But this role is not only about planning, it’s just as much about rolling up your sleeves to get things done. The best part? This a job where you’re free to use your judgement and do what you think will have the biggest impact - and where you’ll not only be allowed but expected to question assumptions. So if you think an event or PR campaign would be more effective than an email newsletter, you can go ahead and organise one; and if you think our branding focus is not quite right, you can fix that too.

*After six months*

* Your understanding of our marketing proposition will mean you are a key voice in setting the overall commercial direction of the business
* Our resources will be invested wisely in an effective marketing mix that you continuously improve through well-structured experiments
* You will be a catalyst for the success of our new products, identifying target customers and the most effective ways to get in touch with them
* You'll have made significant steps (including a full keyword audit) to boosting our search engine ranking
* The workings of our Wordpress site will be deeply familiar to you, so you can craft landing pages, analyse traffic and make data-based decisions to increase our conversion rate

*About us*

GrantTree was founded 6 years ago and employs 28 people. In our culture everyone has the freedom, power and trust to do great work. We call this "open culture":http://granttree.co.uk/open-culture/. It’s been successful for us so far, although it's not for everyone (we suggest you check out our "GlassDoor reviews":https://www.glassdoor.co.uk/Reviews/GrantTree-Reviews-E855262.htm).

*Benefits*

We believe that people should be rewarded fairly for the work they do. At GrantTree there is transparency over salaries and the way we work them out. For this role, this is likely to be in the range £50 - 60k. We also have an annual profit sharing scheme for the whole team.

Aside from money, we offer a great environment where you can be yourself. We want you to develop your skills and fulfil your potential. We have a flexible approach to working, and some of our staff work remotely most of the time. You can also take up to 6 weeks as holiday.

*Equal opportunities*

Teams are stronger when they have a diverse range of people. Applications are welcomed from everyone, regardless of the categories they place themselves into. We also encourage talented ‘square pegs’, who don’t neatly fit into the person specification, to apply.

_Interested in GrantTree but not sure about this role? Join our "recruitment mailing list":https://granttree.co.uk/careers/sign-up/ to be the first to hear about future opportunities._

items.title: Junior Account Manager
items.content:

ParkBee

Almost every major city is dealing with parking problems; Parking is extremely expensive and it’s very difficult to find a parking spot. However, there are sufficient vacant parking locations, only not accessible for the general use. Think of all the private parking garages of office buildings, right in the city centre that could join the sharing economy. ParkBee is a successful Amsterdam based startup that has developed a smart technology to open up these parking locations to the public. We are now expanding and our first stop is London. Check us out at www.parkbee.com.

Job Description

As junior account manager you are focused on creating a world in which parking is no longer a pain. This means finding the underutilized private parking spaces and making them available to the public. That’s the core of the ParkBee initiative and the key responsibility of this role.

ParkBee is growing rapidly, and this function is of crucial importance to further enhance this growth. This role requires attracting new real-estate owners (clients) with parking locations to the ParkBee network. We are looking for an ambitious and outgoing professional that will attract new clients to ParkBee and help manage the existing portfolio of clients. You will have an opportunity to be a part of our sales and acquisition team in London at our Shoreditch office alongside one of the company founders.

Responsibilities:

● Enhance lead generation to realise new acquisitions and optimise the process
● Research and scout new ParkBee locations and find creative ways to get in contact with the right owners
● Develop innovative sales strategies in line with the marketing team to grow ParkBee in the real-estate market
● Work closely with strategic partners on joint procurement initiatives
● Maintain communication to clients about the activities performed and planned activities for their locations
● Inspire the community while building and maintaining a portfolio of clients
● Ensure updates and full-use of Salesforce

Requirements:

● 1+ years of experience in sales or account management (real-estate knowledge in the London market is a huge plus)
● Capacity to independently plan, structure and execute effective sales methods;
● Ability to organise work methods to ensure targets are consistently met.
● Team player with a dynamic, outgoing personality; strong communication skills, both verbal and written, are essential;
● Strong work ethic with enthusiasm to work for a startup;
● Ability to represent your ideas and sell to management team;

The Perks:

ParkBee creates an environment with significant freedom and responsibility. Working for an innovative and growing startup can be challenging but extremely rewarding! You will have an important role in this crucial stage where ParkBee is expanding to new territories. At ParkBee we have the motivation to change the world’s parking industry in a climate-friendly way. We have the proven technology to do so, now it is up to great people to assure we will get this done.
● Work in an entrepreneurial environment at our Shoreditch office in London!
● Sharp, motivated and international team that continues to grow
● A chance to be one of the early employees for our London office.
● Afternoon drinks with mingling with other startups and crazy ParkBee team events


Join us!

Start your journey with ParkBee by sending your CV and motivation to Scott Moran. Creativity is always encouraged!

We are now looking for an experienced Business Development Manager to join the management team to help drive the company’s sales and revenue growth.
As our first dedicated Business Development Manager, you will be responsible for promoting the brand and helping us grow by finding new clients and winning business.

Person Specification

* You’ll be entrepreneurial in your approach and willing to work hard to achieve both the company's vision and your personal targets
* You will be hungry, passionate and genuinely love the work you do. You will have a focus on not only winning business but actually delivering results that your clients love.
* You are driven, energetic and want your next move to be joining a company where you’re truly empowered, with the ownership to shape outcomes and be rewarded for driving growth the way you have always wanted to
* Ability to efficiently manage your time to focus on activities that drive revenue
